labels.text: With Winds, made when Lee Ufan worked between Tokyo and Paris, belongs to a group of paintings (1987–1991) comprised of brushstrokes of similar length and thickness that touch or intersect to form a larger composition. In this work, the vertical and horizontal calligraphic strokes are perpendicular to one another, densely stacked in the lower centre of the composition and becoming loose toward the edges, as if carried by the wind. The strokes are made up of pigments mixed into glue, which allow the gestural traces and materials to become visible. Each brushstroke is a repetition of another, independent yet related.
《隨風》屬李禹煥以長、寬相仿的筆觸互相交錯而成構圖的系列畫作（1987–1991年），當時他在東京與巴 黎分設工作室。此作中橫向與縱向的筆劃垂直相交，於畫幅的中下部密集堆疊，並隨風般向邊緣消散。顏料混合了膠，令筆跡與材質皆表露無遺。一筆復一筆，相互獨立，又相互關聯。

medium.en: oil and mineral pigment on canvas

images.AltText: Oil and mineral pigments on a beige canvas depicting intersecting short, thick brushstrokes in dark beige and blue-black. The strokes are stacked densely in the bottom half of the composition, but become loose as they spread towards the left, right, and upper edges. Each brushstroke reveals the varying shades of the thick pigments.
images.AltTextTC: 直幅米色畫布上，以暗米色及藍黑色顏料繪畫的粗短筆劃縱橫交錯，於畫面下方最為密集，漸漸向左、右、和上方消散。濃稠的顏料顯現出深淺不一的筆刷痕跡。
